The stability condition for a solution of $-\Delta u = f(u)$ is that the second variation at $u$ of the energy associated with the equation is non-negative. This can be expressed as:
\[ \int f'(u) \psi^2 \le \int | \nabla \psi|^2, \quad \forall \psi \in C_c^2, \]
where $C_c^2$ is the set of $C^2$ functions defined on $\mathbb{R}^N$ with compact support.
